message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.NE, cs.SY. 

The paper proposes a novel method for training deterministic neural networks to estimate not only the desired target but also the associated evidence in support of that target. This involves placing evidential priors over a Gaussian likelihood function and training the neural network to infer the hyperparameters of the evidential distribution. The paper applies this method to various benchmarks and computer vision tasks, indicating a focus on machine learning and artificial intelligence (cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV). Additionally, the paper emphasizes the importance of calibrated and robust measures of uncertainty in safety-critical domains, suggesting a potential connection to systems and control (cs.SY). Finally, the paper's use of neural networks and probabilistic modeling aligns with the neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE) sub-category.
